A manly man man scent that's manly-Once, long ago, I left the rural lands teaming with forestry, animals, and endless uninventive sports bars for big city life. Soon after I found myself bereft of the things that smelled of home. While I don't mind diesel soot and overflowing garbage at times, I do long for those old familiar scents. I'd also began to miss the rural activities. I had no lawn to cut, no garage to tinker in, no more camouflage.

Fast forward a decade or two and I stumble upon this bottle of manly goodness. Upon the cracking of the ergonomically designed pop/top lid I quickly discovered that I no longer had to smell of Chad or Brock with Axe, Roy or Bill with Dial, Grayson or Skylar with Dove. No, I could now smell pleasantly obnoxious. Manly obnoxious. My glaring nostrils over-inhaled scents of 2 cycle exhaust, WD-40, and the fresh mailing of a pine through a wood chipper. When washing, I feel like angelic duct tape has wrapped my slightly major finger injury in warmth and comfort of lesser gods.

After two weeks my chest hair has returned, I've rediscovered the Army surplus store, and currently pricing rural tracts of land contains abandoned vehicles and reeking of deer urine. My briefcase now a rucksack and my Kia has become a Ranchero. Thank Cremo, you've helped me become the man I once was. Godspeed.

You also might think it's going to be one of those soaps with the gritty beads in it...or maybe chunks of coal? NOPE! It lathers especially well and therefore lasts a long time. The best part is the scent. It reminds me of old leather bound books with a hint of mint. Two things I would request from AXE: 1) the tube gets difficult to squeeze out the product sometimes, especially if you suffer from arthritis - a pump would be better. and 2) how about this scent as a body spray?

Harry's Fig Body Wash-This is my favorite body wash i have tried in a LONG time and I have purchased some expensive body washes like Molton Brown, Jack Black, and other ridiculously priced body washes. The scent fills the shower and is very pleasant, my girlfriend loves the smell it leaves in the bath. The scent does linger but does not interfere or clash with any cologne. The body wash is about $1-2 more expensive than Old Spice / Axe / Dove / garden variety body wash but it is definitely worth the purchase. Cant speak to the other scents but I will be picking up the Fig again for sure. Anyone looking to try a new body wash should give it a try. Harry's Has A New Fan-First of all, this is NOT a paid promotion and I wasn't given anything. I went to Target needing body wash and decided to pick this up. That being said, GO GET THIS BODY WASH! I've used a lot of body washes- body washes for men, unisex body washes, boutique body washes - and none of them compare to this. I usually run into the same problems like generic scent, too watery, not foaming but not here. This body wash is thick and foams A LOT but doesn't feel like you have to scrub for eternity to get it off. I hate feeling like I have to use half the bottle to get myself clean (especially getting deodorant off). It also doesn't dry out my skin which is definitely a huge plus. Now for the smell... how does one express that this is the BEST smelling body wash I've ever smelled? If you're looking for a light fragrance, this ain't it, chief, but if you want something that smells amazing and lingers on your skin, this is body wash you're looking for. I will definitely recommend this to everyone I know and now, you.

ORIGINAL POST: Let me start by saying I normally love this product, and would give it a 5-star rating as it came from Target. When my Target-purchased supply ran out, I thought I'd subscribe here on Amazon and save a little money. Here's what I found (which appears to be a huge issue, judging by the other comments I've now read):

1) This product from Amazon has virtually no scent, certainly not the fantastic cedarwood that I grew accustomed to from my old bottle. There is a barely perceptable, generic "soap" smell that is not particularly pleasant.

2) The product has a different color & consistency than my old bottle. It's completely clear (vs white) and literally has about 2x the lather. That's not necessarily a bad thing, but taken together with the lack of scent, I'm guessing this could be a knock-off product.

As you can see from the photo, there is a difference in name (the new bottle from Amazon is the "body wash" on the right). I didn't notice that discrepancy when I purchased this from Amazon, rather assuming I found a 1:1 replacement, just in a slightly smaller container. The information on the back of both bottles is pretty similar, and appears to have all the correct company information.

Incidentally, I also have the matching cedarwood deodorant, first purchased from Target, and then I bought more here on Amazon. The Amazon-purchased deodorant smells just like what I bought at Target - no issues.

Bottom line: if you've been using this body wash / all over wash because you love the cedarwood scent, you may be sorely disappointed purchasing it here. I know my next purchase of this stuff will be in a local store once again.

Love the smell - very little needed - skin feels amazing - fantastic value. - I haven't used Dove body wash products before but I am an instant fanâ€¦. I don't remember the name of the last body wash I got because it just ran out right before the Dove products arrived, but I do remember getting it at the store. I went down the aisle, found one in the price range I was comfortable with and that smelled fine, and I took it home. IT worked ok, but compared to this Dove product it was a quite watery, and it didn't smell anywhere as nice, nor did the smell last long.

PROS:
Fragrance - I don't know what fragrance to refer to this by but I really like the smell. The name on the green label is â€œExtra Freshâ€ and maybe that is its name - if so it is named appropriately. I won't bother trying to describe it because I'll mess that up - suffice to say it smells fantastic

Long Lasting smell - I showered at around 4 and it is midnight as I'm writing this and I can still smell the body wash on my skin :)

Consistency - The body wash is really thick and I love how slow moving it is when you squeeze the bottle. Unlike other products that are thinner, you won't get more than you want to use each time you need it - and that saves me money, and saving money makes me smile.

Quantity needed - You really don't need a lot to get a good lather up and have a great wash. A bit around the size of a quarter was enough for my torso front and back = more saving money & more smiles :)

Feeling - I not one for sitting about seeing how my skin feels, but I can definitely say that the skin on my arms feels absolutely wonderful from whatever ingredients are in this, which is probably why it is #1 rated with dermatologists.

Value - It's hard to tell, but my best estimate for how long one bottle will last is 50-60 washes, and that reflects tremendous value at this price.

CONS - None at all - I just hope they still make the product by the time I get to the end of the 4th bottle ;)

SUMMARY - If you are reading this either you don't know Dove, or you do but you are not sure if you will like this product. Hopefully my assessment will help you determine if this is right for you. I'm quite picky when it comes to value for money and how body wash smells, and for me I definitely feel like selecting this product was a nice win for me, and when the 4th bottle is gone, I know what Ill be shopping for next

Not bad, but won't buy again.-I really wanted to like this product. The more every day man brand seemed appealing, and I've been seeing it around Walmart and Target. I've been looking to up my body/hair game a bit more since I just go with standard stuff. This seemed promising and I liked the reviews.

The scent upon opening the lid and smelling was awesome. Nice, strong scent of citrus. I've smelled a few other citrus scented stuff and this one was definitely top notch in that department.

During the wash, the smell lingered and made a good experience in that regard. However, the lather was subpar. The beads were an interesting touch and it helped get me clean, but after a good glob on my hand, I was barely able to get a decent lather on half my body before reaching for more. Half of that with my standard wash (gel without the beads) would have done the job.

After the shower, the scent didn't linger at all. I've only had a real noticeable lasting scent with an Old Spice body wash, so that wasn't too surprising. But still a bit disappointing since the scent was so strong during the wash. Also felt a bit more itchy and dry after this wash.

I'll keep this around if I really need a good scrub down after some running or work outside (and some moisturizer handy for the dryness), but other than that, I won't be purchasing this again. I'm glad I gave it a shot though.

good soap - A "body wash" is essentially another name for liquid soap. The main ingredient in this Dove Men+Care (after water) is what you find in many soaps: sodium laureth sulfate.

This Dove Men+Care is a good soap. It gets me clean. It's not much better or worse then most other soaps.

It does contain fragrance and coloring (Blue 1, Red 33, Yellow 5), which I find unnecessary. I prefer clear soaps and detergents. The fragrance is faint and pleasant. It lingers on my skin. This body wash's color is green (see my photo), the result of combining all those Blue and Red and Yellow coloring agents.

This body wash claims to contain "micromoisture," a "patent filed technology" that's "clinically proven to fight skin dryness better than any regular men's body wash."

I didn't notice any increase in my skin's moisture. But like I said, it's a good liquid soap. Comes in a very big 18 oz bottle, that will last a long time.
